meanings.definition: To stay longer than intended or expected.
meanings.sent1: She kept overstaying at her friend's house, making it difficult for them to have alone time.
meanings.sent2: The tourist was overstaying in the hotel room, unaware that his reservation had ended.
meanings.sent3: The cat was overstaying on the warm windowsill, refusing to move even for dinner.
meanings.sent4: His welcome had long overstayed its invitation, leaving an awkward tension in the air.
meanings.sent5: The smell of burnt popcorn overstaying in the kitchen lingered for hours.

meanings.definition: The act of remaining in a place beyond the time allowed.
meanings.sent1: The overstaying of the students in the library led to complaints from others waiting to study.
meanings.sent2: The overstaying of the delivery truck in the loading zone caused traffic congestion.
meanings.sent3: The overstaying of the party guests resulted in a messy house the next morning.
meanings.sent4: The overstaying of the sun in the sky signaled the approaching evening.
meanings.sent5: The overstaying of the cat on the couch left a trail of fur behind.
